DOCNAME: CASE OF LEON AND AGNIESZKA KANIA v. POLAND
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Administrative proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in LOC .

CARDINAL . In DATE the craftsmen ’s cooperative ( spółdzielnia rzemieślnicza ) “ GPE ” established its seat next to the applicants’ home . It was engaged in a wide range of commercial activities , including various maintenance services for lorries , metal cutting and grinding machines and other small - scale operations in the iron and steel industry .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicants instituted administrative proceedings to have the cooperative cease its activities . They alleged that the level of noise and pollution emitted by the cooperative exceeded a tolerable level .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the liquidation of the craftsmen ’s cooperative “ GPE ” by DATE or alternatively that it switch to activities that did not cause a nuisance . During DATE the cooperative was to adapt its activities in order to comply with the rules on the protection of the environment and the emission of noise .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Director of ORG in PERSON upheld that decision . The applicants appealed , contesting the lengthy period foreseen for the cooperative ’s liquidation and urging its shutdown .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed their appeal ( thus the decision of DATE became final ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants again lodged a complaint with ORG in PERSON alleging that the DATE operations of the cooperative caused unbearable noise and were life - threatening for people living in the vicinity .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Director of ORG in PERSON issued a decision establishing the maximum level of noise to be emitted .

CARDINAL . Due to the non - compliance of the cooperative with the established noise - level limits , by a decision of CARDINAL DATE the Director of ORG in PERSON ordered the cooperative to suspend the operation of all its technical devices . The cooperative appealed to the Minister of the Environment .

CARDINAL . On DATE , as the time - limit for the cooperative ’s liquidation established by the decision of DATE had expired , the applicants lodged a motion with ORG in PERSON to have the decision of CARDINAL DATE executed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants sent a letter to the Director of ORG in PERSON repeating their allegations with regard to the unacceptable noise and pollution emitted by the cooperative . They invoked the decision of DATE ordering the cooperative to cease its activities .

CARDINAL . On DATE in response to their above request ORG in PERSON stated that all documents issued DATE had been destroyed , and thus the decision invoked by them no longer existed . Subsequently ORG referred the case to ORG in PERSON to determine its factual circumstances .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON carried out an inspection of the cooperative .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicants about the state of their case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE notified the applicants of an extension of the time - limit granted to settle their case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE referred the case to the President of PERSON to decide on the legality of the cooperative ’s activities .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON informed the applicants about the state of their case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON informed the applicants that there were no grounds for the cooperative ’s liquidation . It also requested ORG ( ORG ) , ORG in PERSON , and ORG ( ORG ) to carry out an inspection of the ORG . The inspections took place on DATE and DATE , as well as on DATE . It was established that the cooperative ’s activities did not cause a nuisance .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants submitted to ORG in PERSON an original copy of the decision of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants sent a letter to the President of PERSON requesting the liquidation of the cooperative . Their request was transferred to ORG in GPE , which in a letter of DATE informed the applicants that there were no grounds for the cooperative ’s shutdown , having regard to the results of the inspections carried out in DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON checked the level of noise emitted by the cooperative . It was found that it exceeded the permissible threshold .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE addressed to the Director of ORG in GPE the GPE Governor ordered the execution of the decision of CARDINAL DATE on the basis of those documents which had not been destroyed . On DATE ORG in PERSON informed the applicants about the state of their case .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG in GPE reprimanded ( udzielił nagany ) the cooperative and ordered it to bring its activities into compliance with the established noise - levels .
CARDINAL . On DATE the cooperative filed a motion with ORG in PERSON to have the decision of DATE amended in respect of the permissible level of noise .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON informed the applicants about the state of their case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON carried out an inspection of the cooperative ’s premises and found the level of noise emitted to be in conformity with the permissible threshold .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON informed the applicants that there were no grounds to begin enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Director of ORG in PERSON established the noise threshold at a lower level . The applicants appealed to the Minister of the Environment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of the Environment quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case , initiating proceedings for amending the decision of DATE in respect of the permissible level of noise .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON carried out an inspection and found the level of noise emitted by the cooperative to be in conformity with the threshold . On DATE an additional inspection was carried out with the same results .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in PERSON informed the applicants about the state of their case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicants that there were no grounds to begin enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of the Environment quashed the decision of DATE and discontinued the proceedings in the case since , according to a test performed on DATE , the level of noise emitted by the cooperative was in conformity with the established noise threshold .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , the applicants lodged a motion to have their case reexamined . On DATE the Minister of the Environment upheld the decision of CARDINAL DATE . The applicants lodged an appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld his opinion given on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG transferred the case to ORG , requesting that an inspection of the cooperative ’s premises be carried out . The inspection took place on DATE . It was found that the cooperative was not acting in violation of the binding provisions of the construction law , although it had failed to produce valid documents concerning vehicle weighing equipment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicants about the state of their case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a motion with GPE to have the decision of DATE executed and the cooperative liquidated . They further requested that , in accordance with LAW ( Chapter II ) of the DATE PERSON on enforcement proceedings in administration ( ustawa o postępowaniu egzekucyjnym w administracji ) , a fine be imposed on the cooperative for non - implementation of a legally binding decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG requested the cooperative to acquire valid documents for the vehicle weighing device . The applicants filed a complaint against this decision . On DATE ORG quashed the decision and remitted the case for re - examination . On DATE the ORG again ordered the cooperative to acquire documents for the weighing device . The applicants filed a complaint . On DATE the decision was upheld by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicants to supplement their motion of DATE with the decision of CARDINAL DATE joined by an enforcement clause . On DATE ORG returned the motion due to the applicants’ failure to submit those documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the contested decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for reconsideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of the Environment again upheld its decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG , contesting the results of the test performed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicants about the state of their case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG requested the cooperative to produce additional documents for the vehicle weighing equipment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG informed ORG in GPE that the cooperative had acquired the requisite documents for the equipment .
DATE . On DATE ORG in GPE suspended the proceedings until the question whether the level of noise emitted by the cooperative was in conformity with the threshold had been examined by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE due to procedural shortcomings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in Rzeszów carried out an inspection on the cooperative ’s premises and found that the level of noise emitted was in conformity with the relevant provisions .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed a motion with ORG in PERSON requesting to have the decision of DATE enforced and the cooperative liquidated . Their request was transferred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to join the proceedings concerning the cooperative ’s shutdown .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG in GPE and the applicants to provide the original copy of the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a complaint with ORG about the administrative authorities’ inactivity with regard to the cooperative continuing its activities . The complaint was transmitted to ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE discontinued the proceedings concerning the level of noise emitted by the cooperative .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the ORG complaint about inactivity was well - founded and informed the applicants about his intention to lodge a motion with ORG to have administrative enforcement proceedings instituted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Regional Construction Inspector gave ORG an instruction to implement the decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that the cooperative be liquidated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again found their complaint about the non - execution of the decision well - founded and informed the applicants that the motion to have the decision of DATE enforced had already been lodged with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE an on - site inspection took place on the cooperative ’s premises .

CARDINAL . As a result of the above , in a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG stated that some of the cooperative ’s buildings had not been constructed in conformity with the law . He further stated that the vehicle weighing device was to be destroyed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a complaint with ORG complaining about the excessive length of the enforcement proceedings , the inactivity of ORG and , further , the authorities’ failure to dismantle the cooperative ’s buildings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the cooperative lodged a motion with ORG to have the decision of CARDINAL DATE declared null and void and its execution suspended .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG initiated the enforcement proceedings , imposed a fine on the cooperative and issued a document joined by an enforcement clause ordering dismantlement of the weighing equipment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the cooperative filed an objection with regard to the enforcement proceedings . On DATE the ORG decided to overrule their objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings for annulment , finding that the competent authority to examine the case was ORG . Their complaint was thus subsequently transferred for reply to ORG .

DATE . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and discontinued the enforcement proceedings , finding that the enforcement clause had not been issued in accordance with the decision of CARDINAL DATE . The applicants failed to appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to suspend the decision of CARDINAL DATE and , in addition , found no grounds for its annulment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the cooperative informed ORG that it had terminated its commercial activities on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld his own decision of DATE ( after having reconsidered the case ) . The applicants failed to appeal to ORG , although it was open to them to do so .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG conducted an on - site inspection on the cooperative ’s premises . It found that the cooperative had ceased its activities and that the vehicle weighing device had been destroyed . Thus , the proceedings were regarded as completed . The record of the inspection was signed by the applicants without reservation . A subsequent inspection on DATE did not provide any evidence indicating that the cooperative had resumed its activities .
For a presentation of the relevant domestic law , see PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , DATE ; PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , DATE ; and PERSON , no . PERSON , DATE .

The relevant domestic remedies for nonenforcement of a final administrative decision are listed in the PERSON of DATE on enforcement proceedings in administration ( ustawa o postępowaniu egzekucyjnym w administracji ) . In particular , LAW applies to the execution of non - pecuniary obligations . LAW in so far as relevant ( Articles CARDINAL et seq . ) provides for a possibility of imposing a pecuniary penalty on an individual or a natural person compelling him to comply with an imposed obligation .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of the PERSON of DATE on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( LOC o skardze na naruszenie prawa strony do rozpoznania sprawy w postępowaniu sądowym bez nieuzasadnionej zwłoki ) ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) , are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V ; NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII ; and the judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V.

The relevant provisions on acoustic pollution levels emitted into the environment are provided for by LAW DATE on the protection of the environment ( LOC o ochronie środowiska ) . LAW gives the Minister of the Environment the authority to determine permitted external noise - reception levels by reference to the main user of each of the areas . By the LAW DATE the Minister of ORG ( Rozporządzenie Ministra Środowiska ) established permissible noise thresholds for different areas marked on the city development plans , to be issued by the competent administrative authorities .
